Re-written from the ground up. Functionality and performance improvements

The output is now an UNSORTED BAM file, instead of two FASTQ files
Now performs local realignment of soft-clipped bases to identify the real start position, and thus the correct family
Processes records 300-400% faster (~15-20sec per 100,000 records)

Completely rewritten from the ground up. Optimized, with minor feature improvements

Now examined an input file's magic number to determine if the file is gzipped or not
Processes ~100,000 reads in 1sec (on test system, results will vary)

VAF is now calculated for every candidate variant output by snv.py

Merge pull request #4 from morinlab/FilterTesting

ProDuSe variants called by snv.py are filtered based upon the following characteristics:

    Strand bias: Variants with significant strand bias are filtered out
    Molecule counts: Each locus is examined to identify molecules with which support a variant. Molecules are examined from the strongest (DPN) to the weakest (Sn and Sp). If there are too few molecules of a given type at a locus, the next molecule type is examined without counting against the variant. Molecule thresholds scale dynamically based upon the characteristics of the capture space. At higher depths, additional weaker bases will be required in order for a variant to pass filters
    Quality filtering of weak bases (Sn, Sp, Dpn)
    Minimum depth: Currently, no minimum depth is required to call a variant, but this option is available
